title: COVID-19 Therapeutics - Coronavirus
description: Latest guidance on COVID-19 Therapeutics in Virginia. New treatments continue to become available to treat patients for COVID-19.
sitename: Virginia Department of Health- COVID-19 in Virginia
cleaned_text: Get the Latest Guidance COVID-19 Therapeutics in Virginia COVID-19 cases can result in serious illness, hospitalizations and deaths. Treatments are available to treat or prevent COVID-19 infection for [individuals at risk](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/people-with-medical-conditions.html) for severe disease progression. Please use this page to get the latest guidance on COVID-19 Therapeutics in Virginia. Therapeutics administration is best practice. These medications are available in ample supply and should be prescribed for patients who are eligible. New and Notable: [COVID-19 Therapeutics Announcements from ASPR](https://aspr.hhs.gov/COVID-19/therapeutics/Pages/default.aspx) Subscribe to the Healthcare Professionals Newsletter: [here.](https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/VAVDHORCE/subscriber/new?topic_id=VAVDHORCE_174) Previous Healthcare Professionals Newsletters: [here.](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/clinicians/clinician-letters/newsletters/) Summary Table of Food and Drug Administration Authorized Treatments for High-Risk Patients Summary Table of Key Highlights for Preferred Therapeutic Agents Patients who are underinsured or uninsured can visit the VDH website or call their local health department to locate a nearby Federally Qualified Health Center ( [FQHC](https://findahealthcenter.hrsa.gov/)) or [Free Clinic ](https://www.vafreeclinics.org/clinics-in-virginia) for access to COVID-19 treatment. Oral Antivirals The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services has issued guidance to inform Part D sponsors of permissible flexibilities during the COVID-19 public health emergency related to oral antiviral drug(s). The guidance may be accessed [here](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/content/uploads/sites/182/2021/12/OralAntiViral_Guidance_11232021_0.pdf). Monoclonal Antibodies The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services has issued guidance to inform coverage and reimbursement of monoclonal antibodies. Please see the linked flyer and CMS website for reimbursement information below: Additional Resources: [VDH Variant and Therapeutics](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/content/uploads/sites/182/2022/11/COVID-19-variants-subvariants-and-drug-activity.pdf)With variants continuing to evolve and the potential impacts on available therapeutics, VDH continues to update this resource to help providers stay up to date on what COVID-19 drugs are expected to be effective.
